body.p:
Mount Sterling Feb. 10. 1865
Hon. Jas. H. G. Bush
My dear sir.

About two weeks ago I wrote to the Governor asking him to remit a forfeited bond (bail) against myself & Thos. Turner. The application was approved by Mr Dury or Comths Atty. The following are the facts. a fellow named Kincade a soldier in the 10th Ky. Cav. was indicted at the Feb. term 1863 for bigamy. He was arrested shortly after & after the close of the term put in jail & kept there some time when his father came & employed us to defend him. We got him out of jail went on his bail bond for $400 -- for his appearance at the Ensuing August term. Just before that term the 10th Ky. was ordered away from here taking Kincade, leaving Turner & myself in the lurch. We begged off at the Augt term 1863 & Feb. term 1864 but at our last Augt. term ^1864^ Judgt. went against us ^for $400. -- ^ & I myself paid off the comths Atty's 30 per cent. I wish you would go to the Governor & get the Comths portion of the forfeiture remitted. In the hurry of his business he has doubtless overlooked my letter & if it were not for the near approach of our Circt. Court (next monday) I would come down & personally attend to it. & I only ask your good offices in this matter because you have always been so kind a friend, in matters where I had least right to expect it. that I am emboldened in this thing.

Mr. Hensley asked me to say that I join in
his petition sent you for his relief, in having a special law passed removing his case from Wolfe to this County.

Very respy your friend
B. A. Seaven

Montgomery Cir Ct
vs
Seaven & Turner
$400
Remit & hand to Judge Bush Senator
